page.title: 01Mennock Pass SW Wanlockhead
page.content: The area is of steeply rising hills from Mennock Water. Heather and rough grass predominate with sporadic fern growth. Few trees, firs and poor quality rowans by Glenclach Burn. the land is unpopulated, the only road skirts the river. The land is used for sheep grazing, grouse rearing and shooting and beehives are kept on the lower ground. The bus primarily a school service also carries others as required. Leadhills departure 8.30 am. Returns from Janquar 4 pm. the land is owned by Duke of Buccleuch, camping in the pass is tolerated. A white painted laid stone cross alledgedly marks the spot where a nurse cycling downhill died, ref point 854 102 (wrongly stated on Ordnance Survey map).
